elements.text:
You and your family are heading out of town for a few days and your partner asks you to double-check that all the appliances in your house are turned off before you leave. You had to rush to pack so didn't get to check everything. 

Here are some feelings that might happen in the moment:

text: I feel confident everything was shut off.
I feel excited about the trip.
I'm worried that an appliance was left on.
I feel guilty about not checking everything again, but I remind myself that checking once was enough.
I feel scared that I missed something, and then gently focus on what's going on in the car.
